com.hoiio.api
Class SMSAPI

java.lang.Object
  com.hoiio.api.SMSAPI

public class SMSAPI
extends Object

SMS is one of the most popular forms of mobile communications. Chatting between friends, 2-factor authentication by your bank's online portal, receiving alerts from your stock market applications and SMS marketing are just some of the more popular uses of SMS.

The SMS API component of Hoiio API allows developers to send/receive SMS to/from more than 200 countries around the world at a very competitive rate.

Method Detail

sendSMS

public static String sendSMS(HoiioAuth auth,
                             String sender,
                             String dest,
                             String msg)
                      throws HttpPostConnectionException,
                             HoiioRestException
Sends a sms based on the parameters specified

Parameters:
auth - The user authorization object for the request
sender - This is the sender name that the recipient of your SMS will see. For more details, refer to Sender Rebranding.
dest - The recipient number of the SMS. Phone numbers should start with a "+" and country code (E.164 format), e.g. +6511111111.
msg - Contents of the SMS message limited to 459 characters
Returns:
A unique reference ID for this SMS transaction. This parameter will not be present if the request was not successful.
Throws:
HttpPostConnectionException - if there is a connection failure
HoiioRestException - if there were problems using this REST API

sendSMS

public static String sendSMS(HoiioAuth auth,
                             String sender,
                             String dest,
                             String msg,
                             String tag)
                      throws HttpPostConnectionException,
                             HoiioRestException
Sends a sms based on the parameters specified

Parameters:
auth - The user authorization object for the request
sender - This is the sender name that the recipient of your SMS will see. For more details, refer to Sender Rebranding.
dest - The recipient number of the SMS. Phone numbers should start with a "+" and country code (E.164 format), e.g. +6511111111.
msg - Contents of the SMS message limited to 459 characters
tag - This is a text string containing your own reference ID for this transaction. This value will be included in the response for Notification, sms/query_status and sms/get_history for your reference. Max 256 characters.
Returns:
A unique reference ID for this SMS transaction. This parameter will not be present if the request was not successful.
Throws:
HttpPostConnectionException - if there is a connection failure
HoiioRestException - if there were problems using this REST API

sendSMS

public static String sendSMS(HoiioAuth auth,
                             String sender,
                             String dest,
                             String msg,
                             String tag,
                             String notifyUrl)
                      throws HttpPostConnectionException,
                             HoiioRestException
Sends a sms based on the parameters specified

Parameters:
auth - The user authorization object for the request
sender - This is the sender name that the recipient of your SMS will see. For more details, refer to Sender Rebranding.
dest - The recipient number of the SMS. Phone numbers should start with a "+" and country code (E.164 format), e.g. +6511111111.
msg - Contents of the SMS message limited to 459 characters
tag - This is a text string containing your own reference ID for this transaction. This value will be included in the response for Notification, sms/query_status and sms/get_history for your reference. Max 256 characters.
notifyUrl - A fully-qualified HTTP/S callback URL on your web server to be notified when the SMS has been delivered. Refer to Notification parameters for details.
Returns:
A unique reference ID for this SMS transaction. This parameter will not be present if the request was not successful.
Throws:
HttpPostConnectionException - if there is a connection failure
HoiioRestException - if there were problems using this REST API
